tests.name: 2023 USEF First Level Test 1

test_info.average_ride_time: 5:30 (from entry at A to final halt)
test_info.scheduling_note: Suggested to add at least 2 min. for scheduling purposes
test_info.trot_sitting_requirement: All trot work may be ridden sitting or rising, unless otherwise stated

tests.purpose: To confirm that the horse demonstrates correct basics, and in addition to the requirements of Training Level, has developed improved balance, lateral suppleness and throughness, as well as the thrust to perform lengthenings of stride. The horse should be on the bit.

movements.movement: Enter working trot, Halt, salute, Proceed working trot
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of trot; willing, clear transitions; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)

movements.movement: Track left, Half circle left 10m returning to track at H
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of trot; shape and size of half circle; bend; balance; straightness

movements.movement: Half circle right 10m returning to track at M
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of trot; shape and size of half circle; bend; balance; straightness

movements.movement: Circle left 20m in rising trot allowing horse to stretch forward and downward, Shorten reins, Working trot
movements.directive: Forward and downward stretch over the back into light contact, maintaining balance and quality of trot; bend; shape and size of circle; willing, clear transitions

movements.movement: Change rein lengthen stride in trot, Working trot
movements.directive: Moderate lengthening of frame and stride; regularity and quality of trot; straightness; consistent tempo; willing, clear transitions; bend and balance in corner

movements.movement: Medium walk
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; regularity, quality, overtrack; bend and balance in corner; straightness

movements.movement: Change rein free walk, Medium walk
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of walks; reach and ground cover with overtrack of free walk allowing complete freedom to stretch neck forward and downward; straightness; willing, clear transitions

movements.movement: Working trot, Working canter left lead
movements.directive: Willing, clear transitions; regularity and quality of gaits; bend and balance in corners

movements.movement: Circle left 15m
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of canter; shape and size of circle; bend; balance

movements.movement: Change rein, Working trot
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; regularity and quality of gaits; straightness; bend and balance in corner

movements.movement: Working canter right lead
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; regularity and quality of canter; bend and balance in corner

movements.movement: Circle right 15m
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of canter; shape and size of circle; bend; balance

movements.movement: Working trot
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; regularity and quality of trot; straightness; bend and balance in corner

movements.movement: Change rein lengthen stride in trot, Working trot
movements.directive: Moderate lengthening of frame and stride; regularity and quality of trot; straightness; consistent tempo; willing, clear transitions; bend and balance in corners

movements.movement: Half circle left 10m, Down centerline, Halt salute
movements.directive: Bend and balance in half circle; regularity and quality of trot; willing, clear transition; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)

collective_marks.description: Desire to move forward; elasticity of the steps; suppleness of the back; engagement of the hindquarters
Willing cooperation; harmony; attention and confidence; acceptance of bit and aids; straightness; lightness of forehand and ease of movements
Alignment; posture; stability; weight placement; following mechanics of the gaits

collective_marks.category: Rider's Correct and Effective Use of Aids
collective_marks.description: Clarity; subtlety; independence; accuracy of test

tests.name: 2023 USEF First Level Test 2

test_info.average_ride_time: 5:30 (from entry at A to final halt)
test_info.scheduling_note: Suggested to add at least 2 min. for scheduling purposes
test_info.trot_sitting_requirement: All trot work may be ridden sitting or rising, unless otherwise stated

tests.purpose: To confirm that the horse demonstrates correct basics, and in addition to the requirements of Training Level, has developed improved balance, lateral suppleness and throughness, as well as the thrust to perform lengthenings of strides. The horse should be on the bit.

movements.movement: Enter working trot, Halt, salute, Proceed working trot
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of trot; willing, clear transitions; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)

movements.movement: Track right, Change rein lengthen stride in trot, Working trot
movements.directive: Bend and balance in turns; moderate lengthening of frame and stride; regularity and quality of trot; willing, clear transitions; straightness; consistent tempo

movements.movement: Turn down centerline, Leg yield right
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of trot; straightness on centerline; consistent tempo; alignment; balance and flow

movements.movement: Change rein lengthen stride in trot, Working trot
movements.directive: Moderate lengthening of frame and stride; regularity and quality of trot; willing, clear transitions; straightness; consistent tempo

movements.movement: Turn down centerline, Leg yield left
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of trot; straightness on centerline; consistent tempo; alignment; balance and flow

movements.movement: Medium walk
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; regularity, quality, overtrack; bend and balance in corner

movements.movement: Change rein free walk, Medium walk
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of walks; reach and ground cover with overtrack of free walk allowing complete freedom to stretch neck forward and downward; straightness; willing, clear transitions

movements.movement: Working trot, Working canter left lead
movements.directive: Willing, clear transitions; regularity and quality of gaits; bend and balance in corners

movements.movement: Circle left 15m
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of canter; shape and size of circle; bend; balance

movements.movement: Lengthen stride in canter
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; moderate lengthening of frame and stride; regularity and quality of canter; straightness; consistent tempo

movements.movement: Develop working canter
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; regularity and quality of canter; bend and balance in corners

movements.movement: Change rein, Working trot
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; regularity and quality of gaits; straightness

movements.movement: Working canter right lead
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; regularity and quality of canter; bend and balance in corners

movements.movement: Circle right 15m
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of canter; shape and size of circle; bend; balance

movements.movement: Lengthen stride in canter
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; moderate lengthening of frame and stride; regularity and quality of canter; straightness; consistent tempo

movements.movement: Develop working canter
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; regularity and quality of canter; bend and balance in corners

movements.movement: Working trot
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; regularity and quality of trot; straightness

movements.movement: Circle right 20m rising trot allowing horse to stretch forward and downward, Shorten reins, Working trot
movements.directive: Forward and downward stretch over the back into light contact, maintaining balance and quality of trot; bend; shape and size of circle; willing, clear transitions

movements.movement: Down centerline, Halt, salute
movements.directive: Bend and balance in turn; regularity and quality of trot; willing, clear transition; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)

collective_marks.description: Desire to move forward; elasticity of the steps; suppleness of the back; engagement of the hindquarters
Willing cooperation; harmony; attention and confidence; acceptance of bit and aids; straightness; lightness of forehand and ease of movements
Alignment; posture; stability; weight placement; following mechanics of the gaits

collective_marks.category: Rider's Correct and Effective Use of Aids
collective_marks.description: Clarity; subtlety; independence; accuracy of test

tests.name: 2023 USEF First Level Test 3

test_info.average_ride_time: 6:00 (from entry at A to final halt)
test_info.scheduling_note: Suggested to add at least 2 min. for scheduling purposes
test_info.trot_sitting_requirement: All trot work may be ridden sitting or rising, unless otherwise stated

tests.purpose: To confirm that the horse demonstrates correct basics, and in addition to the requirements of Training Level, has developed improved balance, lateral suppleness and throughness, as well as the thrust to perform lengthenings of strides. The horse should be on the bit.

movements.movement: Enter working trot, Halt, salute, Proceed working trot
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of trot; willing, clear transitions; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)

movements.movement: Track left, Change rein lengthen stride in trot, Working trot
movements.directive: Bend and balance in turn; moderate lengthening of frame and stride; regularity and quality of trot; willing, clear transitions; straightness; consistent tempo

movements.movement: Leg yield right
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of trot; consistent tempo; alignment; balance and flow

movements.movement: Circle left 10m, Straight ahead, Track right
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of trot; shape and size of circle; bend; balance; straightness on centerline

movements.movement: Circle right 20m rising trot allowing horse to stretch forward and downward, Shorten reins
movements.directive: Forward and downward stretch over the back into light contact, maintaining balance and quality of trot; bend; shape and size of circle; willing, clear transitions

movements.movement: Working canter right lead
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; regularity and quality of canter; bend and balance in corner

movements.movement: Slightly after K begin single loop to X returning to track slightly before H, maintaining lead
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of canter; shape and size of loop; positioning; balance

movements.movement: Circle right 15m
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of canter; shape and size of circle; bend; balance

movements.movement: Lengthen stride in canter, Working canter
movements.directive: Moderate lengthening of frame and stride; regularity and quality of canter; willing, clear transitions; straightness; consistent tempo

movements.movement: Change rein, Working trot
movements.directive: Willing, calm transition; regularity and quality of gaits; bend and balance in corner

movements.movement: Medium walk
movements.directive: Willing, clear transition; regularity, quality, overtrack

movements.movement: Free walk, Medium walk
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of walks; reach and ground cover with overtrack of free walk allowing complete freedom to stretch neck forward and downward; straightness; willing, clear transitions

movements.movement: Working trot
movements.directive: Willing, calm transition; bend and balance in corner

movements.movement: Leg yield left
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of trot; consistent tempo; alignment; balance and flow

movements.movement: Circle right 10m, Straight ahead, Track right
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of trot; shape and size of circle; bend; balance

movements.movement: Lengthen stride in trot, Working trot
movements.directive: Moderate lengthening of frame and stride; regularity and quality of trot; willing, clear transitions; straightness; consistent tempo

movements.movement: Working canter left lead
movements.directive: Willing, calm transition; regularity and quality of gait; bend and balance in corner

movements.movement: Slightly after F begin single loop to X returning to track slightly before M, maintaining lead
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of canter; shape and size of loop; positioning; balance

movements.movement: Circle left 15m
movements.directive: Regularity and quality of canter; shape and size of circle; bend; balance

movements.movement: Lengthen stride in canter, Working canter
movements.directive: Moderate lengthening of frame and stride; regularity and quality of canter; willing, clear transitions; straightness; consistent tempo

movements.movement: Change rein, Change of lead through trot
movements.directive: Willing, clear transitions; regularity and quality of gaits; straightness

movements.movement: Working trot, Half circle right 10m, Down centerline, Halt, salute
movements.directive: Bend and balance in corner and half circle; regularity and quality of trot; willing, clear transition; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)

collective_marks.description: Desire to move forward; elasticity of the steps; suppleness of the back; engagement of the hindquarters
Willing cooperation; harmony; attention and confidence; acceptance of bit and aids; straightness; lightness of forehand and ease of movements
Alignment; posture; stability; weight placement; following mechanics of the gaits

collective_marks.category: Rider's Correct and Effective Use of Aids
collective_marks.description: Clarity; subtlety; independence; accuracy of test

key_requirements.purpose: Development of thrust from hindquarters; lengthening of stride; improved balance, lateral suppleness and throughness
new_from_training: Lengthening stride in trot and canter
key_requirements.bridge_to_second: First Level develops pushing power and lengthening that becomes collection and medium gaits at Second Level
